body:
if using kafka 1.0, you can use this to make your server if not using
docker (this is already built-in with docker)

https://github.com/openzipkin/zipkin/tree/master/zipkin-autoconfigure/collector-kafka10#quick-start
cool I added a section in that guide about Kafka 0.10+ as well. good luck.

Thanks. so surprise for rapid reply.
I used docker and zipkin code to rebuild the server -jar.
1) The command like belowto start zipkin server.
...
KAFKA_ZOOKEEPER=10.42.89.92:8081 \
KAFKA_BOOTSTRAP_SERVERS=10.42.89.92:8085 \
    /usr/lib/jvm/jdk1.8.0_121/bin/java \
    -Dloader.path='./zipkin-autoconfigure/collector-kafka10/target/zipkin-autoconfigure-collector-kafka10-2.5.3-SNAPSHOT-module.jar,./zipkin-autoconfigure/collector-kafka10/target/zipkin-autoconfigure-collector-kafka10-2.5.3-SNAPSHOT-module.jar!/lib' \
    -Dspring.profiles.active=kafka \
-Dzipkin.collector.kafka.topic=sleuth \
    -cp ./zipkin-server/target/zipkin-server-*exec.jar \
org.springframework.boot.loader.PropertiesLauncher \
--logging.level.zipkin=DEBUG --logging.level.zipkin2=DEBUG
...
2) the autoconfigure->collector-kafka10....zipkin-server-kafka.yml like below
      # Kafka 0.10+ collector.
      bootstrap-servers: ${KAFKA_BOOTSTRAP_SERVERS:10.42.89.92:8085,10.42.91.73:8085,10.42.87.184:8085}
      # Name of topic to poll for spans
      topic: ${KAFKA_TOPIC:sleuth}
      # Consumer group this process is consuming on behalf of.
      group-id: ${KAFKA_GROUP_ID:zipkin_8100}
      # Count of consumer threads consuming the topic
      streams: ${KAFKA_STREAMS:1}
3) I can see the message in kafka, topic sleuth like:
...
"text/plain.... spanTraceID....spansampled ....serviceName:''kafka-trace-1", "address":''..."(can't copy them out from companies PC, some restiction, so just some hand write)
...
4) zipkin server log
...

5） http://192.168.99.100:8100/health （ I proxy the port to 8100 outside docker)
{"status":"UP","zipkin":{"status":"UP","KafkaCollector":{"status":"UP"},"MySQLStorage":{"status":"UP"}},"diskSpace":{"status":"UP","total":19195224064,"free":7342039040,"threshold":10485760}}
6) but nothing in the mysql.
7)  can't find much help from the twiki above, still  digging

It looks like you are using the spring-cloud-sleuth-stream-zipkin approach,
which isn't supported like this as the data format isn't zipkin compatible

try this
http://cloud.spring.io/spring-cloud-sleuth/1.3.x/single/spring-cloud-sleuth.html#_sleuth_with_zipkin_via_rabbitmq_or_kafka

also KAFKA_BOOTSTRAP_SERVERS is an alternative to KAFKA_ZOOKEEPER. you
don't use both. also don't change the yaml just use normal env or
properties as this will make it easier to troubleshoot.
It works， thank you adrian.
No prob
great, the interface is localized

Migrated to springboot2 and verified health endpoints. 
TODO: Implement the collector metrics via Micrometer
https://github.com/openzipkin/zipkin-api/pull/47 starts on the proto3 encoding

Please create a zuul example on github as I suspect many are unfamiliar
with it. Include your workaround. Thanks!

On Sat, 14 Apr 2018, 02:17 momentum123, <notifications@github.com> wrote:

> hi @adriancole <https://github.com/adriancole> @stepanv
> <https://github.com/stepanv> @abesto <https://github.com/abesto>
>
> issue discussed at #1732 <https://github.com/openzipkin/zipkin/pull/1732>
> still exits in latest 2.7.1
> on hitting localhost:9411 it auto redirects to /zipkin
> and while accessing thru zuul-gateway
>
> https://localhost:443/zipkin
> it can not resolve all the components at
> https://localhost:443/zipkin/(resource names)**
> which should actually be
> https://localhost:443/zipkin/zipkin/(resource names)**
>
> although i have done some manaul labour to append the host name
>
> for few resource in my filter but still doesnot work completely
> `
> if(!StringUtils.substringAfterLast(previousUri, "zipkin/").isEmpty()){
> try {
> ctx.setRouteHost(new URL(host+"/zipkin"));
> } catch (MalformedURLException e)
> e.printStackTrace();
> }
>
>    }
>
> `
>
> please suggest any fix its been long since most of the issues related to
> this are closed but issue still persists
>
> —
> You are receiving this because you were mentioned.
> Reply to this email directly, view it on GitHub
> <https://github.com/openzipkin/zipkin/issues/1993>, or mute the thread
> <https://github.com/notifications/unsubscribe-auth/AAD610OqMNtILywdZA_vPBCD7sCGVhdSks5toOvLgaJpZM4TT3rb>
> .
>
hi@brunouska  how are u accessing zipkin thru serviceid or url.
@momentum123, I’m accessing zipkin by Zuul exposed url. Zuul uses Service id at route mapping.

@brunouska  i have tried the same but doesnt work for me tried on earlier version and 2.5.3 and on 2.7.1
doesnt work on any of them please tell me if im doing something wrong and given that im setting the property on jar invocation : java -Dzipikin.ui.basepath=/api/trace/zipkin -jar zipkin.jar
setting property
zipkin.ui.basepath=/api/trace/zipkin

`zuul.routes.zipkin.path=/api/trace/`

`zuul.routes.zipkin.url=http://localhost:9411`

accessing thru gateway

https://localhost:443/api/trace

getting same broken ui without any changes 

https://localhost:443/zipkin


i have tried a workaround in  #1993  works partially: [ui](https://drive.google.com/file/d/1NLYA9tOsqBwRMTNxdu4xrXfCxxVHyf1-/view?usp=sharing)

Let's go @momentum123,

My Spring Boot Version for my implementation is 1.5.9.RELEASE
My Spring Cloud Version for my implementation is Edgware.RELEASE

Here's my Zuul routes config, at my YML:

zuul:
  ignored-services: "*"
  prefix: /api
  routes:
    trace:
      path: /tracing/**
      serviceId: bahauser-trace-server

Here's my Zipkin Config, at my YML:

eureka:
  instance:
    lease-renewal-interval-in-seconds: 5
    instance-id: ${spring.application.name}:${vcap.application.instance_id:${spring.application.instance_id:${random.value}}}
    prefer-ip-address: true
  client:
    registryFetchIntervalSeconds: 5
    region: default
    service-url:
      defaultZone: http://${bahauser-discovery-server.username}:${bahauser-discovery-server.password}@${bahauser-discovery-server.host}:${bahauser-discovery-server.port}/eureka/

zipkin:
  ui:
    basepath: /api/tracing/zipkin

When accessing Zipkin thru Zuul, i use "http://localhost:8080/api/tracing/zipkin/", note the "/" at the end, you have to put it in order to access the UI. You can handle this with a redirection if you want it, at my needing this not a issue. Try with this settings.

You can not get it working we could make a git repository only with the modules involved. I have so many other things, like rabbitmq, auth, so on... If you can not get working I put something at Git Hub for you.
This was a little tricky for me to get working, pay attention to the minimum details at your configuration.
Glad to help. :)
is that trace in storage?

Here are the benchmarks. This time will happen once for all endpoints built from the same IP.

Ex. `endpoint.toBuilder().serviceName("foo").build()` does not re-parse

```
Benchmark                             Mode  Cnt  Score   Error  Units
EndpointBenchmarks.parseIpv4_addr     avgt   15  0.055 ± 0.003  us/op
EndpointBenchmarks.parseIpv4_literal  avgt   15  0.039 ± 0.001  us/op
EndpointBenchmarks.parseIpv6_addr     avgt   15  0.047 ± 0.002  us/op
EndpointBenchmarks.parseIpv6_literal  avgt   15  0.264 ± 0.003  us/op
```
might expose this functionality differently.. will let it sit until the rest of proto3 is done

all of your http connections are in use. Sometimes people have separate
servers for collector traffic vs UI.

ES_MAX_REQUESTS controls the amount for the current process

https://github.com/openzipkin/zipkin/tree/master/zipkin-server#elasticsearch-storage
#1791 seems this one is the answer, checking.
this api proved to be the most convenient
@adriancole I'am not config the storage, I guess it should be memory storage model.

@shakuzen @marcingrzejszczak can you help vet this issue. I'm concerned about adding more core dependencies to the base server. I thought there were people who are already using PCF with zipkin and rabbit

if you cannot access the trace via /api/v2/trace/your_trace_id then the server didn't receive it. Either the trace wasn't sampled or it dropped along the way. You can look at metrics to see if things are healthy https://github.com/openzipkin/zipkin/blob/master/zipkin-server/README.md#collector

feel free to troubleshoot via gitter https://gitter.im/openzipkin/zipkin

issues are better for changes to the code

I can take a closer look tomorrow as it is already late here. I believe Marcin and Reshmi already have run Zipkin on PCF. I have easy access to a CF instance but not PCF (no rabbit service for me).
In general, though, you can use placeholders for variables provided by bound CF services, which is how I would try to do this now. So you should be able to use the URI provided by the bound service as the rabbit uri for the Zipkin server.

I've confirmed that things are working.

manifest - https://github.com/spring-cloud-samples/sleuth-documentation-apps/blob/master/zipkin-server/manifest.yml


```yml
applications:
- name: docssleuth-zipkin-server
  memory: 1024M
  instances: 1
  host: docssleuth-zipkin-server
  path: build/zipkin.jar
  services:
    - docssleuth-rabbitmq
    - docssleuth-mysql
  env:
    SPRING_PROFILES_ACTIVE: cloud
    DEBUG: "true"
    RABBIT_URI: ${vcap.services.docssleuth-rabbitmq.credentials.uri}
```

Trace:
https://docssleuth-zipkin-server.cfapps.io/zipkin/traces/1473953b3f9b37e5

Example to run:
https://github.com/spring-cloud-samples/sleuth-documentation-apps#running-acceptance-tests-of-cf

NOTE: The spans were sent via HTTP but Zipkin has managed to connect to rabbit. Remember to user `RABBIT_URI` not `RABBIT_ADDRESSES`
interop tests for this are in #1998 I will backfill more unit tests tomorrow
I have just tried it and that works! Thanks for the very quick response and resolution. Would it be a good idea to add this to the RabbitMQ Documentation as another configuration example ?
going to revise the encoding approach as it isn't as quick as it could be due to multiple length calculations implicit in the format

I'm assuming the important part is below.. the other variables like SPRING_PROFILES_ACTIVE are not needed?

```yaml
  services:
    - your-rabbitmq
  env:
    RABBIT_URI: ${vcap.services.your-rabbitmq.credentials.uri}
```

We should likely prefix any special instructions with how to provision "your-rabbitmq" and put them in the autoconfigure/collector-rabbitmq README with that section linked from the rabbitmq section of the normal server README I guess?
actually moving speed even faster isn't urgent. will just complete the encoder
Added the Collector Counter using Micrometer and delegated the **HealthEnpoint** to the root  path`/health`
Implemented all the meters, polished tests.
Closing this PR to breakdown the tests and the Micrometer/Boot2 upgrade in to separate ones.
all encoding features are now in, but there is some tests left to port from the other pull request which is compat testing against protoc.
thanks for the details!
well done sir!
so it is odd that a local span would not have a timestamp.. that's what happened here. I will filter out so that bad data won't crash the ability to see things.
https://github.com/openzipkin/zipkin/pull/2009 should fix it

added note on the endpoints.

as to how to secure data ingestion via the api that should be put in zipkin-server and somewhere in brave because it affects them both, should be done in a different PR.
thanks!

Might be useful to link to our httpd doc somehow as proxying the UI is a
bit tricky
https://github.com/openzipkin/zipkin/tree/master/zipkin-ui#apache-http-as-a-zipkin-reverse-proxy
done.
thanks so much!

custom servers are unsupported per https://github.com/openzipkin/zipkin/blob/master/zipkin-server/src/main/java/zipkin/server/EnableZipkinServer.java

however, we will be moving to spring boot version 2.0 soon anyway. Please watch pull requests for status on this, as it is work in progress.
cc @openzipkin/core
dupe of https://github.com/openzipkin/openzipkin.github.io/issues/62
ok test coverage is now ... covered

whatever our default registry is sounds fine. please followup with a small
PR (run the affected bench class in IDE just to check)

ps the old (pre micrometer) registry was inefficient so we special cased it
with buffers. probably should double check the before and after results
just in case.

you need to run https://github.com/openzipkin/zipkin-dependencies when
using elasticsearch or Cassandra

reverted the naming convention as too many other things broke. going with the document approach:

For your prometheus, moving forward make sure your config has a _total on the end for the counters.
```diff
       # Received message count
       - source_labels: [__name__]
-        regex: '(?:gauge|counter)_zipkin_collector_(.*)_([^_]*)'
+        regex: '(?:gauge|counter)_zipkin_collector_(.*)_([^_]*)_total'
         replacement: '${2}'
         target_label: transport
       - source_labels: [__name__]
-        regex: '(?:gauge|counter)_zipkin_collector_(.*)_([^_]*)'
+        regex: '(?:gauge|counter)_zipkin_collector_(.*)_([^_]*)_total'
         replacement: 'zipkin_collector_${1}'
         target_label: __name__
```

Also, replace `http_requests_total` with `http_request_duration_seconds_count`
this is the ultimate fix https://github.com/openzipkin/zipkin/pull/2026

what I mean to ask is how filebeats is used anyway. for example no library

so I am asking how filebeats is involved in zipkin data.

Now the filebeat supports these output methods ([Configure the output](https://www.elastic.co/guide/en/beats/filebeat/current/configuring-output.html)):
```
Elasticsearch
Logstash
Kafka
Redis
File
Console
```
These outputs are all common components, and AFAIK the filebeat only can config one output method. In production environment a various of the log file should be collected, so couldn't specify the output is the zipkin api.

@tsg  @ruflin

a change to our main server should be due to a supported transport.

as far as I can guess, you have a custom zipkin sender or maybe even custom
tracer which puts json into a log.

instead of having us guess can you mention exactly what is generating this
trace data and why filebeats is your only choice?

we have other types of issues and custom setups especially unknown ones
should not affect our build. we have a "rule of 3" policy which means at
least a few different sites need a common concern before we add a feature
to the server everyone uses.

first step is showing on github exactly what you are doing.
It isn't obvious to me why we would intentionally not track UI latency... Mind elaborating a bit more? I might just not understand.

> These outputs are all common components, and AFAIK the filebeat only can config one output method. In production environment a various of the log file should be collected, so couldn't specify the output is the zipkin api.

I'm not sure I fully understand that sentence. Though I get the general appeal of just sending out information once and then using it multiple times — for example for logs and traces.

Since you already seem to have Filebeat -> Kafka our general approach would then be Logstash to get the data to Elasticsearch for logging and you might be able to forward the data to Zipkin for tracing as well. There is a community plugin for a [Logstash to Zipkin output](https://github.com/whitemerry/logstash-output-zipkin); while it seems to be unfinished that would be a good approach in general. We see it pretty much as a feature that the Beats only have a single output (at the moment) and for any further distribution and splitting you'd use Logstash — optionally with a queue in between.
